intro: Mesembryanthemum ligneum, commonly known as the woody ice plant, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant features a woody stem with fleshy, often hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or red, appearing in clusters and blooming during the warm season. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance.
